e4: The CFO's concerns about depressing stock price and hurting retail investors with the new policy seem valid, making it a less desirable option. The current policy, although intentionally biased, has been understood by sophisticated investors, allowing them to make their own adjustments, and no one is apparently misled.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure transparency, accuracy, and honesty. It should not intentionally mislead or deceive stakeholders, and all material information should be disclosed without bias. In this context, the current policy's intentional underreporting is concerning, as it creates an uneven playing field favoring sophisticated investors over retail ones. A more nuanced approach would be to provide clear guidance on earnings calculations, allowing investors to make informed decisions and reducing potential deception risks.
e6: Yes. I would ask the management team to provide evidence of why only sophisticated investors understand and adjust for the bias in the current policy, and how they plan to ensure transparency and fairness when implementing the new policy. I'd also like to know what steps they will take to protect retail investors from potential losses.
q9: Oumuamua (2017) - A cigar-shaped asteroid, approximately 400 meters in length, was detected passing through our solar system on October 19, 2017. It is estimated to have originated from a distant star outside of the solar system, making it the first confirmed interstellar object observed passing through our solar system.
